result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

*NOT ON RECORD*Defendant Leslie Anne Stepniewski appeared by phone.  Attorney Gerard Werner appeared by phone for Leslie Anne Stepniewski.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
Discovery recently received. Offer received.  Attorney Werner indicates DE has another case 22CF368 and asked to keep cases together. Discovery was recently received and needs more time to review, request additional Scheduling Conference.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.
